item.title: Babs add a quote by Flannery O' Connor
item.description: "Where you come from is gone, where you thought you were going to never was there, and where you are is no good unless you can get away from it" -- Flannery O' Connor

item.title: Babs add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "I will not wait to love as best as I can. We thought we were young and that there would be time to love well sometime in the future. This is a terrible way to think. It is no way to live, to wait to love." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Babs add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "When he went back to the fire he knelt and smoothed her hair as she slept and he said if he were God he would have made the world just so and no different." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Babs add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "You invite things to happen. You open the door. You inhale. And if you inhale the chaos, you give the chaos, the chaos gives back." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Babs add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "You forget what you want to remember, and you remember what you want to forget." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Babs add a quote by Joe Meno
item.description: "What I've learned is that there is nothing in this life that does not fail to disappoint us, even our own deaths." -- Joe Meno

item.title: Babs add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "I haven't the slightest idea how to change people, but still I keep a long list of prospective candidates just in case I should ever figure it out." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Babs add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "People who cease to believe in God or goodness altogether still believe in the devil... Evil is always possible. And goodness is eternally difficult." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Babs add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "February is pitiless, and it is boring. That parade of red numerals on its page adds up to zero: birthdays of politicians, a holiday reserved for rodents, what kind of celebrations are those? The only bubble in the flat champagne of February is Valentine’s Day. It was no accident that our ancestors pinned Valentine’s Day on February’s shirt: he or she lucky enough to have a lover in frigid, antsy February has cause for celebration, indeed." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Babs add a quote by Agatha Christi
item.description: "I like living. I have sometimes been wildly, despairingly, acutely miserable, racked with sorrow; but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing." -- Agatha Christi

item.title: Babs add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Babs add a quote by Emily Bronte
item.description: "It was not the thorn bending to the honeysuckles, but the honeysuckles embracing the thorn." -- Emily Bronte

item.title: Babs add a quote by Emily Brontë
item.description: "Proud people breed sad sorrows for themselves." -- Emily Brontë

item.title: Babs add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Every heart sings a song, incomplete, until another heart whispers back. Those who wish to sing always find a song. At the touch of a lover, everyone becomes a poet." -- Plato

item.title: Babs add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "Never explain―your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Babs add a quote by Federico García Lorca
item.description: "To burn with desire and keep quiet about it is the greatest punishment we can bring on ourselves." -- Federico García Lorca

item.title: Babs add a quote by Elle Newmark
item.description: "...unrequited love does not die; it's only beaten down to a secret place where it hides, curled and wounded. For some unfortunates, it turns bitter and mean, and those who come after pay the price for the hurt done by the one who came before." -- Elle Newmark

item.title: Babs add a quote by Banksy
item.description: "The thing I hate the most about advertising is that it attracts all the bright, creative and ambitious young people, leaving us mainly with the slow and self-obsessed to become our artists.. Modern art is a disaster area. Never in the field of human history has so much been used by so many to say so little." -- Banksy
